required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reach for Health Study: Obesity-related Mechanisms and Mortality in Breast Cancer Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Obesity-related Mechanisms and Mortality in Breast Cancer Survivors

brief_summary.textblock: This objective of this randomized controlled trial is to conduct a 2x2 test of a lifestyle intervention and metformin (a drug used to treat diabetes) to investigate how these treatments, alone or in combination, affect biomarkers associated with breast cancer survival. The Reach for Health Study will enroll 340 overweight/obese, postmenopausal breast cancer survivors. After completing the screening process and baseline measures, participants will be randomized in equal numbers to: (1) placebo, (2) metformin, (3) lifestyle intervention and placebo, or (4) lifestyle intervention and metformin. The intervention was powered on the main effects and the planned analyses are to compare: Metformin to Placebo and a separate comparison of Lifestyle intervention to control. The interventions will last for 6 months. Concentrations of circulating biomarkers will be assessed at baseline and 6 months.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Main effects of the factorial design were the planned primary analysis and what the study was powered on.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Insulin measured as percent change from baseline
Glucose measured as percent change from baseline
C-reactive protein measured as percent change from baseline
Bioavailable testosterone measured as percent change from baseline
Serum hormone binding globulin measured as percent change from baseline

intervention.description: Week 1: 500 mg at dinner time Weeks 2-4: 1000 mg at dinner time Weeks 5+: 500 mg in morning; 1000 mg at dinner time
Week 1: 1 pill at dinner time Weeks 2-4: 2 pills at dinner time Weeks 5+: 1 pill in morning; 2 pills at dinner time
Telephone-based lifestyle intervention (dietary change and physical activity) for weight loss.
Set of standard health education materials provided to participants at single time point (immediately after randomization)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI at least 25.0 kg/m2
- Diagnosed with Stage I, II, or III breast cancer within past 5 years
- Treatment with total mastectomy or breast-sparing surgical removal of cancer with clear macroscopic margins, and axillary dissection, followed by adjuvant breast radiation
- Not scheduled for or currently undergoing chemotherapy
- Accessible geographically and by telephone
- Able to communicate dietary and physical activity data via telephone
- If taking statins, tamoxifen, or aromatase inhibitors; able and willing to remain on treatment for 6-month study period
- Post-menopausal at diagnosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Preliminary bloodwork outside of specified ranges
- Evidence of renal insufficiency, liver disease, or congestive heart failure
- Currently taking corticosteroid pills or steroid hormone therapy (including vaginal estrogen creams)
- Recent initiation (< 3 months ago) of thiazides or Î²-blockers
- Taking insulin or other antidiabetic drug
- Other primary or recurrent invasive cancer in past 10 years
- Unable to commit to study requirements

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor, Department of Family & Preventive Medicine

group.title: Metformin + Lifestyle Intervention
group.description: Metformin: Week 1: 500 mg at dinner time Weeks 2-4: 1000 mg at dinner time Weeks 5+: 500 mg in morning; 1000 mg at dinner time Lifestyle intervention: Telephone-based lifestyle intervention (dietary change and physical activity) for weight loss.

group.title: Placebo + Lifestyle Intervention
group.description: Placebo: Week 1: 1 pill at dinner time Weeks 2-4: 2 pills at dinner time Weeks 5+: 1 pill in morning; 2 pills at dinner time Lifestyle intervention: Telephone-based lifestyle intervention (dietary change and physical activity) for weight loss.

reported_events.desc: The study was designed and powered for a main effects analysis and therefore the results are presented as per the original statistical plan: Metformin vs. Placebo and Lifestyle intervention vs. Control.

group.title: Metformin vs Placebo
group.description: Main effect for Metformin vs Placebo

group.title: Lifestyle vs. Control
group.description: Main effect for the lifestyle intervention vs control intervention

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
